pli-tv-pvr12:0.2.eng: The verses on how to accuse properly

pli-tv-pvr12:0.3.eng: Questions and answers on accusing, etc.

pli-tv-pvr12:1.3.eng: What is the purpose of the Sangha?

pli-tv-pvr12:1.4.eng: Why is there the taking of advice?
pli-tv-pvr12:1.4.comm: Sp 5.359: Matikammaṁ vuccati mantaggahaṇaṁ, “Taking advice is called matikammaṁ.” Vmv 5.359: Mantaggahaṇanti tesaṁ vicāraṇāgahaṇaṁ, suttantikattherānaṁ, vinayadharattherānañca adhippāyagahaṇanti attho, “Mantaggahaṇa: learning from them by investigation; the meaning is learning the meaning from the experts on the discourse and the experts on the Monastic Law.”

pli-tv-pvr12:2.1.eng: The purpose of accusing is reminding,

pli-tv-pvr12:2.2.eng: The purpose of reminding is restraint;

pli-tv-pvr12:2.3.eng: The purpose of the Sangha is scrutiny,
pli-tv-pvr12:2.3.comm: Sp 5.359: Saṅgho pariggahatthāyāti tattha sannipatito saṅgho vinicchayapariggahaṇatthāya; dhammādhammaṁ tulanatthāya suvinicchitadubbinicchitaṁ jānanatthāyāti attho, “Saṅgho pariggahatthāya: the Sangha is assembled there for the purpose of investigating to make a decision. The meaning is that it is for the purpose of weighing up what is the Teaching and what is contrary to the Teaching, and for the purpose of knowing what is well and badly decided.”

pli-tv-pvr12:4.3.eng: In line with the discourses and the Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr12:4.4.eng: In line with what has been laid down,

pli-tv-pvr12:5.1.eng: Consider carefully the proper procedure of examination,

pli-tv-pvr12:5.2.eng: As formulated by the skilled Awakened One,

pli-tv-pvr12:5.3.eng: Well-spoken in line with the training rules—

pli-tv-pvr12:5.4.eng: Do not ruin your future rebirth.

pli-tv-pvr12:5.5.eng: You should seek what is beneficial,

pli-tv-pvr12:5.6.eng: At the right time, what is connected with the goal.

pli-tv-pvr12:6.1.eng: The statements of the accuser and the accused,

pli-tv-pvr12:6.3.eng: If the accuser says the accused has offended,

pli-tv-pvr12:6.4.eng: But the accused says he has not,

pli-tv-pvr12:7.2.eng: Both should be dealt with in line with their admission.

pli-tv-pvr12:7.3.comm: Sp 5.359: Lajjiṁ paṭiññāya kāraye; alajjiṁ vattānusandhināti attho. Tasmā eva paṭiññā lajjīsūti gāthamāha, “The meaning is that the conscientious should be dealt with according to their admission, but the shameless according to their conduct. This is why the verse says paṭiññā lajjīsu.”

pli-tv-pvr12:7.4.eng: But there is no such thing among the shameless;

pli-tv-pvr12:7.5.eng: For even if the shameless should speak a lot,

pli-tv-pvr12:7.6.eng: They should be dealt with in line with their conduct.

pli-tv-pvr12:8.2.eng: In that an admission is not effective?

pli-tv-pvr12:8.4.eng: What are they like, the people called shameless?

pli-tv-pvr12:10.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:10.4.eng: What are they like, the people called conscientious?

pli-tv-pvr12:11.1.eng: They do not intentionally commit offenses,

pli-tv-pvr12:11.3.eng: Nor do they follow a wrong course—

pli-tv-pvr12:12.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:12.4.eng: What are they like, those who accuse illegitimately?

pli-tv-pvr12:13.1.eng: They accuse at the wrong time, untruthfully,

pli-tv-pvr12:13.3.eng: They accuse with a mind of ill will, not a mind of good will—

pli-tv-pvr12:13.4.eng: Such a person is called one who accuses illegitimately.

pli-tv-pvr12:14.2.eng: Such a person is called one who accuses illegitimately.

pli-tv-pvr12:14.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:14.4.eng: What are they like, those who accuse legitimately?

pli-tv-pvr12:15.1.eng: They accuse at the right time, truthfully,

pli-tv-pvr12:15.3.eng: They accuse with a mind of good will, not a mind of ill will—

pli-tv-pvr12:15.4.eng: Such a person is called one who accuses legitimately.

pli-tv-pvr12:16.2.eng: Such a person is called one who accuses legitimately.

pli-tv-pvr12:16.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:16.4.eng: What are they like, the people called ignorant accusers?

pli-tv-pvr12:17.1.eng: They do not know the right order;
pli-tv-pvr12:17.1.comm: Sp 5.359: Pubbāparaṁ na jānātīti purekathitañca pacchākathitañca na jānāti, “They do not know the right order: they do not know what was said first and what afterwards.”

pli-tv-pvr12:17.3.eng: They do not know the sequence of statements;

pli-tv-pvr12:17.5.eng: Such people are called ignorant accusers.

pli-tv-pvr12:18.2.eng: Such people are called ignorant accusers.

pli-tv-pvr12:18.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:18.4.eng: What are they like, the people called learned accusers?

pli-tv-pvr12:19.3.eng: They know the sequence of statements;

pli-tv-pvr12:19.5.eng: Such people are called learned accusers.

pli-tv-pvr12:20.2.eng: Such people are called learned accusers.

pli-tv-pvr12:20.3.eng: And may I ask you something else:

pli-tv-pvr12:21.1.eng: One accuses because of failure in morality,

pli-tv-pvr12:21.2.eng: And for failure in conduct and view;

pli-tv-pvr12:21.3.eng: Also one accuses for failure in livelihood—

pli-tv-pvr12:21.4.eng: Because of this it is called accusing.”

pli-tv-pvr12:22.1.eng: The verses on how to accuse properly are finished.
